basics.name: Dyniv Ioan Thuriaf BEKALE NZOGHE
basics.label: Full stack Developer | AI Developer
basics.summary: I'm an IT developer with a taste for artificial intelligence, application and software design and development. I'm also well-versed in cybersecurity. I'll be delighted to bring your projects to life.

work.name: Ba&sh
work.summary: As part of the AI Clinic of Aivancity, we collaborated with Ba&sh's data team on the prediction of customer returns.
highlights: Improved website performance by optimizing code
responsibilities: Studied common reasons for returns (size issues, defects, inaccurate descriptions, etc.).
Collected customer reviews from Trustpilot using web scraping.
Processed historical return data from Bash.
Identified trends by product category and origin store.
Visualized insights using Power BI.
Explored machine learning models (Logistic Regression, SVM, Random Forest).
Generated synthetic data to balance the dataset.
Trained models with oversampling techniques.
Achieved 91% accuracy with a Random Forest classifier.
Proposed improvements, including refining return reasons and optimizing dataset balance.
achievements: In-depth analysis of customer returns and predictive models revealed potential strategies for optimizing the customer experience and reducing returns.

work.name: Public procurement
work.summary: Development of a business application for electronic public procurement regulation.
highlights: Contributed to a major project that streamlined internal workflows, improving efficiency by 30%
responsibilities: Design and development of a web-based Public Procurement Management application
Design of models and architecture for the application
System and network maintenance
Technical support for users
Troubleshooting and resolution of hardware and software problems
Administration and management of IT assets

work.name: Fontecsys Sarl

projects.name: Signal Processing with Python
projects.description: It demonstrates core concepts like signal generation, manipulation, Fourier Transform (FFT) for frequency analysis, filtering, sampling (Nyquist theorem), and convolutions through executable code examples and explanations.
highlights: Signal manipulation: Creation, manipulation and visualization of digital signals using Python libraries such as NumPy and Matplotlib.
